oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sliding wear resistance of iron aluminides
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SHARMA, G
SUNDARARAMAN, M
PRABHU, N
GOSWAMI, GL
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: room-temperature ductility
abrasive wear
fe3al-based alloys

chromium

behavior

iron aluminide
sliding wear
wear
intermetallics
fe3al
ordered structures
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Room temperature dry sliding wear behaviour of iron aluminides containing 28% aluminium and various amounts of chromium has been investigated using pin on disk wear tester. The aluminides were heat treated to have ordered DO3 structure. It was found that wear rate of the aluminides increased with the increase of applied normal load and sliding speed. Wear resistance of the aluminides increased with increase in chromium content. SEM observation of the worn surface showed that the microcutting and microploughing were the dominant sliding wear mechanisms.
